pr_title: feat(plugins): Constructor dependency injection for extensions

timeline.message: feat(plugins): Constructor dependency injection for extensions

timeline.bodyText: I'm not actually seeing this used anywhere.  What are the plans for this?
timeline.author: jonsie

Any class in the Plugins API with this annotation will be available for injection into an + * Extension at initialization time. + * + * 

{@code
+ * @Extension
+ * class MyExtension {
+ *
+ *   private final HttpClientProvider httpClientProvider;
+ *
+ *   public MyExtension(HttpClientProvider httpClientProvider) {
+ *     this.httpClientProvider = httpClientProvider;
+ *   }
+ * }
+ * }
+ */ +@Target(ElementType.TYPE) +@Retention(RetentionPolicy.CLASS) +@Documented +public @interface Injectable {}

replies.bodyText: You're right, it's not used in this PR. It would be used for SDKs, such as HttpClient and so-on. It's a marker annotation that informs plugin developers what is available for injection, and could be used to auto-generate docs on what is available. It's possible that we could tie it back into the DependencyProviders, but I'm not sure if there's value at this point.
replies.author: robzienert

timeline.author: jonsie

timeline.bodyText: It wont be long before we build up another DependencyProvider, so let's make the DependencyProvider objects separate beans and then add them to this extensionInjector factory so we keep the arguments clean (i.e. -- ConfigResolver is a dependency for ConfigDependencyProvider and not ExtensionInitializer).
